test.question:
Complete the following passage. 

Dear Mr. Rogers: I visited your store to determine a price range for installing a new wood-burning stove in my home. I openly disclosed that my budget for the project was around $4,000, with $5,000 being the absolute limit of my funds. I was told that this would be enough. However, your subsequent proposal with amounts totaling over $6,800 ________
answers: were disappointing in light of my budget limitations.
was disappointing in light of my budget limitations.
be disappointing in light of my budget limitations.
been disappointing in light of my budget limitations.
test.answer: was disappointing in light of my budget limitations.

test.question:
Select the option that correctly completes the sentence. 

I asked that my deposit check be returned as I could not afford the project. I then received a bill from you for $129 for consultation. While I understand that your time is valuable, none of your literature indicates a charge for the initial discussion of a potential project. Quite truthfully, I would not have scheduled the appointment ________
answers: had I known there was a charge.
should I known there was a charge.
if I had knowed there was a charge.
if I had of known there was a charge.
test.answer: had I known there was a charge.

test.question:
Select the option that correctly completes the sentence. 

I called to discuss the invoice and explained over the telephone that I felt I was ________ to compromise by paying one-half the bill.
answers: misled, at that time, I offered
misled at that time, I offered
misled. At that time, I offered
misled at that time I offered
test.answer: misled. At that time, I offered

test.question:
Select the option that correctly completes the sentence. 

The store representative told me that someone would call me back regarding the invoice and ________. Since no one has called me to express non-acceptance of my offer, I am enclosing a check for $64.50.
